speaker: Louis Michel,
english: Louis Michel, Member of the Commission . (NL) Mr President, I should like to remind Mr Claeys that Commissioner Rehn has already explained in detail that it would be impossible for him to stay. Whilst that really was unfortunate for the debate, I have tried to stand in for him by clarifying arguments and answering questions. I will, of course, report back to Mr Rehn, and I am convinced that in the next meetings, he will probably be able to come and answer those questions in person.
original: Louis Michel, Member of the Commission . (NL) Mr President, I should like to remind Mr Claeys that Commissioner Rehn has already explained in detail that it would be impossible for him to stay. Whilst that really was unfortunate for the debate, I have tried to stand in for him by clarifying arguments and answering questions. I will, of course, report back to Mr Rehn, and I am convinced that in the next meetings, he will probably be able to come and answer those questions in person.
